units.measure_basis: End-to-end length of a roasted coffee bean.
units.notes: Tiny but mighty. Please do not measure entire hallways one bean at a time.

units.measure_basis: Diameter of a standard plain M&M candy.
units.notes: Color does not affect the unit conversion, despite rumors.

units.measure_basis: Standing height of a typical gummy bear.
units.notes: Height measured before any tragic snack-related incidents.

units.measure_basis: Width across the pink eraser on a standard wooden HB pencil.
units.notes: The part you use when you change your mind halfway through packing.

units.measure_basis: Approximate exposed height of a fresh pencil-top eraser.
units.notes: Shrinks in direct proportion to bad decisions in math class.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard US postage stamp.
units.notes: Does not include emotional weight of the letter it carries.

units.measure_basis: Width of a standard US postage stamp.
units.notes: Useful for very small distances and very patient people.

units.measure_basis: Length of a classic 2x4 LEGO brick (stud to stud).
units.notes: Step on enough of these and any distance feels too long.

units.measure_basis: Width of a classic 2x4 LEGO brick.
units.notes: Exactly wide enough to hide in deep carpet and await bare feet.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard No. 1 paper clip.
units.notes: Stationery’s answer to duct tape.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard AA battery.
units.notes: Good for flashlights, remotes, and very small hallway measurements.

units.measure_basis: Side length of a typical square saltine cracker.
units.notes: Crumbles easily under pressure, like some of us.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard cotton swab.
units.notes: For cleaning small spaces and making big mistakes in ears.

units.measure_basis: Long edge of a standard credit card.
units.notes: Distances measured this way may encourage spending.

units.measure_basis: Short edge of a standard credit card.
units.notes: When you want to measure your tap-to-pay regrets.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard deck of playing cards on its side.
units.notes: Perfect unit for measuring how stacked the odds are.

units.measure_basis: Diameter of a regulation baseball.
units.notes: Suitable for measuring both home runs and foul distances.

units.measure_basis: Wingspan of a small folded origami crane.
units.notes: Folds flat, unlike your travel budget.

units.measure_basis: Long side of a standard rectangular tea bag (without string).
units.notes: Best used while steeping over cruise videos.

units.measure_basis: Edge length of a typical sugar cube.
units.notes: Sweet little unit of measurement.

units.measure_basis: Edge length of a standard gaming D6 die.
units.notes: Roll enough of these and any distance becomes a gamble.

units.measure_basis: Average body length (plug retracted) of a USB thumb drive.
units.notes: Where itineraries and 47 versions of your packing list live.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard cylindrical lip balm tube.
units.notes: SPF not included in the conversion factor.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard domino tile.
units.notes: Distances measured this way may be prone to chain reactions.

units.measure_basis: Long side of a standard hotel door keycard.
units.notes: Cruise card cousin, often seen near elevators.

units.measure_basis: Side length of a small square sticky note.
units.notes: Ideal unit for measuring how many reminders you’re ignoring.

units.measure_basis: Height of a small porcelain espresso cup.
units.notes: Good for short shots and short distances.

units.measure_basis: Length of a modern car key fob.
units.notes: Includes the distance between ‘lock’ and ‘where did I park?’

units.measure_basis: Height of an average coffee mug.
units.notes: Found in the wild near laptops and late-night planning sessions.

units.measure_basis: Rim-to-rim diameter of an average coffee mug.
units.notes: Important for gauging donut dunk compatibility.

units.measure_basis: Side length of a typical square waffle.
units.notes: Syrup coverage may vary by operator.

units.measure_basis: Overall height of a standard A19 household bulb.
units.notes: Not recommended for use as a nightlight-sized ruler.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard 12 oz beverage can.
units.notes: Good for estimating distances between you and your next caffeine hit.

units.measure_basis: Diameter of a standard 12 oz beverage can.
units.notes: Also known as “how much space it takes up in the cup holder.”

units.measure_basis: Length of a US dollar bill.
units.notes: Conversion rates may vary, distances do not.

units.measure_basis: Height of a US dollar bill.
units.notes: Good for measuring small problems and big tips.

units.measure_basis: Average height of a modern smartphone.
units.notes: Screen size may be exaggerated, distance units are not.

units.measure_basis: Average width of a modern smartphone.
units.notes: Measured without the seven protective cases.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard hot dog.
units.notes: Relish not included in the unit conversion.

units.measure_basis: Length of a new, unsharpened wooden No. 2 pencil.
units.notes: Distance from test anxiety to doodles in the margin.

units.measure_basis: Curved peel-on length of an average banana.
units.notes: Units may vary slightly by level of ripeness and drama.

units.measure_basis: Height of a typical grocery-store pineapple (without tall leaves).
units.notes: Official fruit of vacation-mode measurement.

units.measure_basis: Diameter of a regulation size 5 soccer ball.
units.notes: No yellow cards for using metric here.

units.measure_basis: Diameter of a large dinner plate.
units.notes: Great for measuring buffets, emotionally and physically.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard sandwich loaf.
units.notes: Give us this day our daily unit of measurement.

units.measure_basis: Nominal length of a fast-food footlong sandwich.
units.notes: Actual length may be subject to marketing optimism.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard tall cereal box.
units.notes: Great for measuring the distance to the toy that isn’t inside anymore.

units.measure_basis: Diameter of a large takeout pizza.
units.notes: A unit best shared with friends. Or not. Your call.

units.measure_basis: Approximate width of a 15-inch class laptop.
units.notes: Measured from deadline to distraction.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard glossy magazine.
units.notes: Good for distances between you and the next cruise ad.

units.measure_basis: Height of a typical full-size tablet.
units.notes: Measured in inches, enjoyed in streaming hours.

units.measure_basis: Long side of a classic rectangular board game box.
units.notes: Includes extra distance for house-rule arguments.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard bowling pin.
units.notes: Distances measured this way are right up your alley.

units.measure_basis: Length of a typical shoebox.
units.notes: A surprisingly common storage unit for old cruise cards.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard kitchen rolling pin.
units.notes: Good for flattening dough and unrealistic itineraries.

units.measure_basis: Head-to-base-of-tail body length of an average house cat.
units.notes: Measured only when the cat briefly cooperates.

units.measure_basis: Length of an average cat tail.
units.notes: Distance varies if you step on it. Please don’t.

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard sitting teddy bear.
units.notes: Comfort unit of measurement. Great for kids’ cabins.

units.measure_basis: Height of a carry-on-size rolling suitcase.
units.notes: Measured from wheel to handle (retracted), not to ‘overstuffed’.

units.measure_basis: Length of a typical bakery baguette.
units.notes: Fragile unit. Handle with care (and butter).

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard skateboard deck.
units.notes: Great for distances that feel slightly risky.

units.measure_basis: Length of an adult baseball bat.
units.notes: For measuring home-run distances in the smallest possible way.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard bed pillow.
units.notes: Good for estimating how many pillows it takes to hog the bed.

units.measure_basis: Length of a classic stick umbrella.
units.notes: Roughly equal to the distance rain can detect your forgetfulness.

units.measure_basis: Long side of a standard bath towel.
units.notes: Perfect for measuring lounge chair reservations at the pool.

units.measure_basis: Average standing height of an emperor penguin.
units.notes: Formal unit of measurement. Built-in tuxedo.

units.measure_basis: Approximate flipper-to-flipper wingspan of an emperor penguin.
units.notes: Measured when the penguin is explaining something very important.

units.measure_basis: Overall length of a full-size acoustic guitar.
units.notes: Distances measured this way are best accompanied by campfire songs.

units.measure_basis: Length of an average snowboard.
units.notes: Mostly useful in climates where cruises are a necessity.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard 6-foot folding table.
units.notes: Perfect for measuring potlucks and puzzle projects.

units.measure_basis: Height of a typical 7.5-foot artificial Christmas tree.
units.notes: Height measured before cat-assisted ornament removal.

units.measure_basis: Length of a small two-person canoe (~16 feet).
units.notes: For distances that feel like a gentle paddle away.

units.measure_basis: Length of a regulation table tennis table.
units.notes: Perfect for measuring competitive sibling rivalry.

units.measure_basis: Width of a regulation table tennis table.
units.notes: Side-to-side distance of ‘I thought that was out!’

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard outdoor picnic table.
units.notes: Includes room for snacks and one family argument.

units.measure_basis: Approximate length of a modern minivan.
units.notes: The distance between ‘Are we there yet?’ and sanity.

units.measure_basis: Average body length of an adult sheep.
units.notes: Count them carefully or you’ll fall asleep mid-calculation.

units.measure_basis: Length of an adult road bicycle.
units.notes: Great for measuring distances you swear are ‘just a short ride.’

units.measure_basis: Height of a standard kitchen refrigerator.
units.notes: Height measured from floor to top, not to the secret snack stash.

units.measure_basis: Length of a queen-size mattress.
units.notes: Perfect for measuring ‘just five more minutes’ of sleep.

units.measure_basis: Width of a queen-size mattress.
units.notes: Represents the frontier between ‘your side’ and ‘my side’.

units.measure_basis: Length of a typical three-seat couch.
units.notes: Measured from armrest to armrest, not from nap to nap.

units.measure_basis: Length of a Smart Fortwo car.
units.notes: Small car, big parking confidence.

units.measure_basis: Length of an average VW Golf/Beetle-sized car.
units.notes: Classic unit for measuring road trips and nostalgia.

units.measure_basis: Approximate height of a tall adult giraffe (~18 ft).
units.notes: Excellent for measuring distances that really stretch the neck.

units.measure_basis: Height of a typical utility pole (~35 ft).
units.notes: Wires, birds, and perspective not included.

units.measure_basis: Length of a standard 40-foot school bus.
units.notes: Unit of choice for measuring field trip logistics.

units.measure_basis: Length of a typical 45-foot city bus.
units.notes: Includes standing room for regrets about not leaving earlier.

units.measure_basis: Approximate length of a single intercity passenger car (~85 ft).
units.notes: Great for measuring journeys with built-in snacks.

units.measure_basis: Lane length from foul line to first pin (~60 ft).
units.notes: Ideal for measuring how far your ball didn’t hook.

units.measure_basis: Approximate width of a small single-story house (40 ft).
units.notes: Good for comparing cabins to ‘home.’

units.measure_basis: Baseline-to-baseline length of a tennis court (78 ft).
units.notes: Perfect for measuring distances that are ‘out by a mile.’

units.measure_basis: Length of an NBA basketball court (94 ft).
units.notes: From one three-point line to the other, plus drama.

units.measure_basis: Estimated width of a small 4-lane bowling alley building (~200 ft).
units.notes: Plenty of room for strikes, spares, and nachos.

units.measure_basis: Length of a large ladder fire truck (~45 ft).
units.notes: For measuring distances that are a big red deal.

units.measure_basis: Average length of a blue whale (~82 ft).
units.notes: Do not attempt to park one in the cruise port, even hypothetically.

units.measure_basis: Height from heel to torch (~151 ft).
units.notes: A very patriotic unit of measurement.

units.measure_basis: Length of a Boeing 747-400 (~231.5 ft).
units.notes: When your distance needs jumbo-jet energy.

units.measure_basis: Length of an American football field, goal line to goal line (300 ft).
units.notes: End zones not included, arguments about calls are.

units.measure_basis: Length of RMS Titanic (~882 ft, rounded).
units.notes: Purely for scale. Your ship is much safer, we promise.

units.measure_basis: Height of the Eiffel Tower (~1083 ft, including antennas).
units.notes: For distances that truly tower over everything else.

units.measure_basis: Approximate width between two legs at the base (~410 ft).
units.notes: A very French way to measure how wide something feels.

units.measure_basis: Representative length of a large cruise pier (~1200 ft).
units.notes: Measured in steps between ship and the promise of shore excursions.

units.measure_basis: A modest airport runway of about 5000 ft.
units.notes: Enough distance for takeoff, landing, and mild anxiety.

units.measure_basis: A large international runway of about 6000 ft.
units.notes: For distances that feel like they’ll never end, like boarding groups.

units.measure_basis: Height of Mount Everest (~29,236 ft), approximate.
units.notes: Do not attempt to climb this unit just to check our math.

units.measure_basis: Alleged length of a standard unicorn horn.
units.notes: Allegedly. No unicorns were harmed in the making of this measurement.

units.measure_basis: Alleged wingspan of a small, polite dragon (~20 ft).
units.notes: Allegedly. Please do not feed real fire to test this.

units.measure_basis: Theoretical length of a single swirl of fairy dust.
units.notes: Allegedly. Sparkle factor may vary by belief level.

units.measure_basis: Height of a classic pointy wizard hat.
units.notes: Measurements taken with maximum whimsy and minimum skepticism.

units.measure_basis: Estimated length of a two-rider magic carpet.
units.notes: Allegedly. Not FAA approved, but very efficient in stories.

units.measure_basis: Height of a tall fairytale castle tower (~50 ft).
units.notes: Ideal unit for measuring ‘once upon a time’ distances.

units.measure_basis: Width of an oversized magical storybook when opened.
units.notes: Where happily-ever-after meets overly-large font size.

units.measure_basis: Approximate height of Abraham Lincoln’s iconic stovepipe hat.
units.notes: Historical, but feels magical enough for our purposes.

units.measure_basis: Height contribution of one emperor penguin in a perfect vertical stack.
units.notes: Do not attempt this. The ASPCA and common sense strongly object.

units.measure_basis: Height contribution of one teddy bear in an imaginary balancing tower.
units.notes: If you manage this in real life, please send photos (carefully).

units.measure_basis: Space taken by one coffee cup in a neat row, handle turned politely.
units.notes: Distances measured this way may feel shorter after caffeine.

units.measure_basis: Height contribution of one mug in a hypothetical vertical stack.
units.notes: Do not attempt this at home unless you enjoy shattered ceramics.

linear: That's roughly ~{count}~ {unit_plural} laid end to end.
If you lined up ~{count}~ {unit_plural}, you'd get something about this long.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} in a neat little row — give or take a wiggly one.
Imagine ~{count}~ {unit_plural} politely forming a conga line to show this distance.
~{count}~ {unit_plural}, nose-to-tail, making an adorable little parade.
About ~{count}~ {unit_plural} from tip to tip, more or less.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} in a row — a sight your inner child would definitely approve of.
Approximately ~{count}~ {unit_plural} if you trust our math (which is whimsical at best).
stacked: If you pile ~{count}~ {unit_plural} on top of one another, you'd get about this height.
That's about ~{count}~ {unit_plural} tall — assuming perfect balance and zero wind.
Approximately the height of ~{count}~ {unit_plural} performing a daring circus act.
Imagine ~{count}~ {unit_plural} balancing upward like a questionable Jenga tower.
Roughly the height of ~{count}~ {unit_plural} practicing acrobatics.
If ~{count}~ {unit_plural} stood on tiptoe, you'd get something close to this.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} stacked gently, like a wholesome but improbable totem pole.
Picture ~{count}~ {unit_plural} forming a vertical conga line. That's this tall.
wingspan: That's about ~{count}~ {unit_plural} from fingertip-to-fingertip, wingspan style.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} wingspans wide — majestic, if a bit chaotic.
If ~{count}~ {unit_plural} stretched their arms (or flippers) out, you'd get this distance.
Approximately ~{count}~ {unit_plural} if measured by dramatic arm gestures.
Think of ~{count}~ {unit_plural} all going, 'Look how wide I can go!'
About ~{count}~ {unit_plural} wide if everyone participates in Wingspan Wednesday.
magical: ~{count}~ {unit_plural}, allegedly. No unicorns or cryptids harmed.
Approximately ~{count}~ {unit_plural}, if the legends are to be believed.
Old sea stories say this equals ~{count}~ {unit_plural}.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} — or so the enchanted mariners whisper.
Roughly ~{count}~ {unit_plural}, as confirmed by imaginary cartographers.
~{count}~ {unit_plural}, according to the Ministry of Whimsy.
Legend claims it's ~{count}~ {unit_plural}, though results may vary.
nautical: Equivalent to about ~{count}~ {unit_plural} along the promenade deck.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} if measured in 'strolls to the buffet' units.
About ~{count}~ {unit_plural} long — or three bored-seafarer-paces per {unit_singular}.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} from bow to stern in cruise-math.
Measured in 'I'm late for trivia' strides, that's ~{count}~ {unit_plural}.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} if you follow the port side railing and admire the view.
That's ~{count}~ {unit_plural} — or one solid ‘oops, wrong deck’ walk.
~{count}~ {unit_plural}, as determined by very scientific deck wandering.
cozy: Imagine ~{count}~ {unit_plural} making a soft little line across the floor.
~{count}~ {unit_plural}, the kind grandma would approve of.
If ~{count}~ {unit_plural} held hands, they'd stretch this far.
absurdist: ~{count}~ {unit_plural}, which feels both excessive and exactly right.
Approximately ~{count}~ {unit_plural} or possibly twelve; it's hard to say.
~{count}~ {unit_plural} long, give or take cosmic variance.
~{count}~ {unit_plural}, and everyone nodded like that made sense.

admonitions: please don’t try this at home
your mother would absolutely disapprove
your father would simply raise one eyebrow
your pastor would like a quiet word about this
granny warned us about ideas like this
the ASPCA strongly recommends otherwise
common sense gently shakes its head
your chiropractor advises against any stacking attempts
the ship’s captain sighs at the thought
local seagulls have filed a formal complaint
your future self would regret attempting this
the laws of physics have recused themselves
your inner child approves, but your adult knees do not
maritime tradition recommends staying seated
the ship’s safety officer is already writing paperwork
your insurance provider is whispering 'no'
crew members recommend keeping all limbs inside the vessel
the deck chair attendants are not paid enough for this
your cabin steward would prefer you didn’t
this violates at least three unwritten cruise rules
the buffet line judges you silently
your Fitbit would call this 'an incident'
nearby flamingos would lose respect for you
the towel animals refuse involvement
your coffee mug collection is concerned
the ducks at Perfect Day say 'please stop'
your best friend says 'this sounds like a *you* problem'
the otters union would like to distance itself from this concept
your cat would disapprove (as usual)
the penguins have voted unanimously against it
the dolphins asked us to tell you 'no, thank you'
several llamas have reported emotional distress at the idea
the squirrels of the world are suspicious
your childhood goldfish says this is how it all starts
the Royal Caribbean DJ will not remix this attempt
someone’s grandmother is praying for you right now
your middle school gym teacher is disappointed again
your accountant would not advise this
the muster drill instructions did *not* cover this scenario
Poseidon rolled his eyes just a little
your shoe laces are not prepared for this level of ambition
your old youth pastor says 'remember who you are'
your mom’s best friend from church disapproves deeply
the ship’s WiFi is buffering in protest
your favorite waiter says 'maybe tomorrow'
the moose federation expressed mild alarm
your pet rock thinks this is too much
the universe is quietly judging this idea
your mug collection wants no part in this
the choir in your mind has stopped singing
your pillow fort structural engineer says ‘hard pass’
your imaginary friend is reconsidering the friendship
the rubber ducks in your bathroom have concerns
your cardigan aunties do not approve
the clouds briefly frowned
your neighbor’s dog sensed something and barked about it
a passing butterfly shook its head
your inner voice is sending awkward emojis
